text: all 3 news articles >> The Weekly wins award for foreign aid budget cuts program ABC Online 21 Hours ago External Link: Charlie Pickering won the ACFID award for his humorous response to Australian foreign aid cuts. Charlie Pickering and the team from ABC TV's The Weekly have won the 2015 Australian China Focus: Chinese farmers turn to e-commerce to rid poverty Xinhua News Agency 20 Hours ago BEIJING, Oct. 15 (Xinhua) -- Huo Liang earns about 1,000 yuan a month (158 U.S. dollars) running an online shop to sell millet, a humble but nutritious food popular among Chinese. His earnings are remarkable 10 footballers from Eritrean national squad seek asylum in Botswana: NGO 22 Hours ago GABORONE (BOTSWANA) - Ten footballers from Eritrea's national squad are seeking political asylum in Botswana, where on Tuesday they played in a qualifier for the 2018 World Cup, an Eritrean non-governmental No gunfire, keep men and women apart and don’t let the bride cut the cake. Chechnya’s South China Morning Post 20 Hours ago What makes for a proper wedding in the eyes of Chechen authorities? No gunfire, keep the men and women at a distance on the dance floor and don’t let the bride cut the cake. These are among the recommendations Couple sue over Japan’s six-month ban on remarriage for divorced women Japan Times 20 Hours ago A Shizuoka couple in their 20s filed a lawsuit Thursday over the six-month ban on remarriage for newly divorced women, calling it unconstitutional. They are seeking ¥3 million in compensation.
